comment_data.body:
`vim.lsp.LocationOpts.OnList` is an utility type shared between multiple LSP handlers, and so we keep it as flexible as possible in order to accommodate all those implementations.

I don't think that the type is incorrect in this case. Instead I think of the type being an "interface" defining the expected fields we expect from these tables, but more fields might indeed be present.

title: Wrong `on_list` typing in `vim.lsp.buf.document_symbol`
